pullRequest.body:
`Ordinal.bsup` is planned to be deprecated.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [afd3f4f2f3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19145/commits/afd3f4f2f37438691c7d2f5d700d22b59b2ad7ad)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ opow`
`+ zero_opow_le`
`- opow_def`
`- pow`
`- zero_opow'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|5095|-1|porting notes|

Current commit [afd3f4f2f3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/afd3f4f2f37438691c7d2f5d700d22b59b2ad7ad)
Reference commit [e3327a6356](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/e3327a6356ba7550fa37b50f16e934a4d59dc6af)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
The theorems in lines 42-60 completely characterize the ordinal exponential. The definition (particularly written as it is with `1 - a`) should remain a private implementation detail.
lgtm. Perhaps keep `opow_def`, but using the new definition?
lgtm. Perhaps keep `opow_def`, but using the new definition?
The rest of the changes look good to me.

```suggestion
We call this `opow` in theorems in order to disambiguate from other exponentials. -/
```

I would keep this one and the previous unprivated (though the porting note can go, as you've done). It's true that the following lemmas characterise the exponential, but it's still useful to have lemmas describing it anyway! For instance, `one_opow` follows from the definitions just as much as `zero_opow'` does, but it's still valuable to have that one.

`opow_def` is hideous and I can't imagine it ever being useful. It also exposes the precise definition of `opow` which seems bad for maintainability - there are in fact other definitions we could use in the future. `x ^ y` is the order type of functions `y -> x` that take the value 0 cofinitely, under lexicographic ordering.

`zero_opow'` feels to me like an abuse of junk values (specifically the fact `a - b = 0` for `a < b`) but it is used once in this file to golf a result, so I can keep it in if you want.

Alright, let's compromise to deprecate `opow_def` (it'll ask for a comment, and you can say that one of `opow_zero`, `opow_succ`, `opow_limit` should be used instead), and keep `zero_opow'`. 

(Now that I think about it, a statement `0 ^ a = if a = 0 then 1 else 0` is sometimes useful... But I'll leave that up to you.)
This comment is a useful one - might be nice to also add it to the module docstring.

pullRequest.title: chore(SetTheory/Ordinal/Exponential): redefine ordinal exponential without `bsup`
